data.title: Busy, loud & fun
data.text:
Our first stop in Rochester was the Genesee Brew House, 25 Cataract St, Rochester, NY 14605, (585) 263-9200. Founded in 1878, The Genesee Brewing Company is one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in the United States, producing the Genesee line of beers, including the iconic Genesee, Genny Light and the original Genesee Cream Ale. The Genesee Brewing Company is part of North American Breweries. 

The Genesee Brew House was originally called Building #9, the bottling plant, but it has now transformed its 9,200 square-foot industrial space, over a hundred years old, into a beer destination, featuring interactive exhibits, multimedia content, gift shop, pilot brewery and pub-style restaurant. The Brew House was created to capture and share with you the long history of The Genesee Brewery - one of the largest and oldest continually operating breweries in America. But the Brewery itself isn't half as interesting as the beer and the people who make it.

The displays and gift shop are on the first floor along with a tasting area and below that, the actual "Pilot Brewing" apparatus. Food is served on the second floor and there is an elevator for those who need one and for food to be brought up to the small, open kitchen stuck in a corner behind supplies. The 40 foot bar constructed from barrels was three-deep when we arrived on a Friday afternoon! Perhaps the patrons were celebrating the end of the acrimonious election on the previous Tuesday. "Pilot Batch" craft brews are made at the restaurant, and for those wishing to sample, beer flights are available.

We both had Santa Fe salads with Genny beer of course but I also tried a "Rocktoberfest" craft beer - dark and quite pungent. The place was busy and loud, very loud. There is a terrace where one can view the Genesee River cascading over a falls in the middle of the city.

data.title: Unique establishment featuring High Falls Brewing beers
data.text: Good bar food, burgers, salads etc. If dining outside on the terrace, great view of the falls. The Genesee Brew House features all beers brewed by the adjacent High Falls Brewing Co. (formally Genesee Brewery), and also features "Pilot Batch" craft brews made right at the restaurant. For those wishing to sample, Beer Flights are served. They also have a gift shop with Genesee and Dundee beer related products.

data.title: A fun brew house lots of atmosphere,
data.text: I've visited the Genesee Brew House on a few occasions since it opened, most recently for weekday/workday lunch with a friend.  I definitely missed having a brew or hard cider, but will have to wait for a return visit.  Our server, Jenny, was very good and made recommendations.  My friend and I shared the pretzel appetizer (delicious), then I had a salad and he had a burger.  He said his burger was great.  I didn't care for my salad (it had a lot of field greens which aren't my favorite), so I ate the chicken topping and other salad fixings, then left the greens.  And with the chicken add on, my salad totaled about $15.  Pretty pricey; I wished I had ordered something else. I will return on a weekend and be more selective on menu selections.

data.title: Great place to eat
data.text: The first floor is like a mini museum with the brewery in back where you can get a flight. Upstairs is the restaurant with great views of the falls. If you feel like taking a walk after, there are great walkways and bridges to sight see (or take some cool selfies).

data.title: Neat place for business or casual lunch
data.text:
Recently had a casual business lunch at Brew House. 
Food and service were very good. Prices reasonable. Have daily specials different and delicious. Had the chicken and waffles with porter sauce. Wow good. Neat atmosphere including 1st floor Brewery Shop.

data.title: Family Weekend
data.text: Really cool place to visit and eat. Right next to Genesee Brewery. Good food and great atmosphere. Amazing view of river and falls. Nice tasting room as well.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Excellent surroundings, excellent food, excellent service. Very god pubgrub, and the beer is awesome!

data.title: Beer Atmosphere Doesn't Overpower Good Food
data.text: Although the clientele (e.g., Haley Davidson and other leather folks) are somewhat different from most places I eat, the general atmosphere was no noisier than more "refined" places I've been to. For a Wednesday night, it was pretty busy, but the service was fine. They even had a decent cab on the menu, and my wife had a glass of their pilot batch of a new (seasonal?) chocolate salted caramel porter. They don't have mixed drinks (her normal preference), but she was very pleased with this beer. I tasted it, too, and as a total nondrinker of beer, I was pretty impressed. Now for the food. I had the roasted vegetable panini (sing., panino?), with a side of cole slaw. The sandwich was excellent, and the cole slaw was much better than average, though a little watery. It came with a decent dill pickle spear, but they forgot the kettle chips. My wife had the shepherd's pie, which she marveled at. I'd like to try visiting again in warmer weather when we could enjoy eating on the patio with a view of High Falls.

data.title: Brews, Views and Vittles
data.text:
A modern pub in an old beer bottling plant next to the river with great views of the falls with pub grub.

Located just north of downtown, it offers a typical pub/comfort food menu, supplemented by specials.  However the attraction is a variety of Genesee brew products, some their standards and some sold seasonally or only at the brewery.  Check the website for current offerings.  As the interior features brick walls and an open ceiling the noise level is high, but not overwhelming with TV's to provide entertainment.  There is an outside patio with a terrific view of the Genesee River falls.

We had the nacho platter, tri-color chips loaded with salsa, cheese and jalapeños, which hit the spot and then we each had their wurst platter.  It usually comes with a bratwurst, chorizo and andouille, but with a kind request to the server we were able to make a substitution, due to the non heat resistant palate of one of us.  The platter was served with mashed potato, sauerkraut and coarse grained mustard.  All the sausages were very tasty, and not as hot as one might expect.  We liked it and it seemed to be a favorite as we saw many others being served.  Their burger menu is extensive and includes an option to build your own.  Besides the wurst platter, they offer a shepherd's pie which I wish to try on a return visit.  A great way to start off the culinary scene in the city.

data.title: Nice place!
data.text: The main draw for this place is going to be the views.  Sat on the rooftop, it has beautiful views.  You could see into th city and over the falls.  We just got appetizers and they were very good.  Just kind of basic foods that you can get anywhere but the view makes this a definite must go to.

data.title: Don't be afraid!
data.text: I have not been a big fan of genny beer but you have to go here!  We went on my birthday cuz I've heard about how fun and beautiful it is and we loved it!  Did a tasting and it was really good!  I like genny beer!!!  There are tours which we didn't do and a lot of stuff to walk through and things to purchase.  Restaurant too which we did eat at and it was delicious!  No French fries though..only chips with food.  The view is amazing, great walkway overlooking Genesee river.  A definite must see!

data.title: Amazing Location, Excellent Food
data.text: Went here for lunch, and sat on the outside balcony overlooking the waterfalls.  I had an excellent sausage plate and my wife had the turkey burger.  Server Sarah was very attentive and knowledgeable. Make sure you visit the roof top for a better view than the balcony.  Nice little museum describes the beer history in Rochester.  In addition to it's own brand, Genesee Brewery makes beer for several major labels in the U.S.  Stop in the tasting room and take home a growler.

data.title: Great lunch!  and dont forget to sample the brews at the sampling bar!
data.text: Very good food, good service and good surroundings.  definitely should try the fried pickles.  and you should definitely try some brews at the sampling bar where you can try their current offerings at a very reasonable price.

data.title: Best HIGH Falls View
data.text: Genesee Brew House is a MUST for out of towners or for an easy happy hour.  Enjoy a delicious bouquet of pretzels and variety of Genny craft brews not available in bottle anywhere. The Rachel sandwich is the best!  The view of High Falls can't be beat anywhere in Rochester.

data.title: Very Cool Place
data.text: Met some family there & had a great time eating lunch & chatting & chatting. Food was good & service was excellent (our server was Shan HH). The menu has lots to choose from. Of course there's lots of shopping to do in the gift shop after lunch.

data.title: Cool place! Great food and beer!
data.text: Really neat piece of Rochester NY history, and great food and service. Has a nice bar for socializing, and great place to wait for your table.

data.title: Nice lunch spot...l
data.text: Stopped by for lunch on a random trip to Rochester.  We had a great view of the river from our table.  The food was pretty good and reasonably priced.

data.title: Friday Night Dinner for 4
data.text: The Nacho appetizer plate was average; way too much cheese and not enough of other advertised toppings. The Fried Pickles appetizer plate was awesome. We each had a specialty sandwich for dinner. They were hearty and delicious. The warm kettle chips were great. Service was great considering the large crowd.

data.title: Fun with a great view of falls.
data.text: Loved it here. Had lunch outside overlooking the falls. The entire set up is great. Great shop and tasting area. Food was very very good. Had the special chicken n waffles. Breaded chicken with a chocolate beer stout glaze and waffles with a beer butter and maple drizzle.

data.title: Great atmosphere, great beer, food was hit or miss.
data.text:
Perogies appetizer was a HIT!  Gotta have that again. 

The black and bleu burger was a miss. Had to send first one back because it was charred (I ordered medium well but it was somewhere past well done).   My server was more than happy to get me a new one, which was better but still not noteworthy.   I'll go for something else next time.  

Service was outstanding, friendly, and lots of fun.
